name: Tentamort

specials.name: Constrict
specials.description: 1d6+5 bludgeoning, DC 21. Only one creature at a time can be grabbed and therefore constricted.

specials.name: Reposition
specials.description:
Requirements The % has grabbed an immobile creature (paralyzed, unconscious or dying) beyond 5 feet. 
Effect the creature is moved adjacent to the %.

specials.name: Feast
specials.description:
Requirements The % has grabbed an adjacent and immobile creature (paralyzed, unconscious or dying) that has taken poison damage 
Effect The % drinks the liquified organs of that creature. The creature is drained 1 and takes 1d6+5 damage, and the % gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. The drained condition persists until the creature receives any sort of healing.

specials.name: Implant Eggs
specials.description:
Requirements an adjacent creature is grabbed and immobile (paralyzed, unconscious or dying).
Effect the % lays eggs in that creature exposing it to the % disease, and then releases that creature..

specials.name: Tentamort Venom
specials.description: Saving Throw DC 18 Fortitude; Maximum Duration 6 rounds; Stage 1 1d6 poison (1 round); Stage 2 1d6 poison and drained 1. The tentamort venom liquifies the victimâ€™s internal organs into a rancid slurry.

specials.name: Tentamort Disease
specials.description: Saving Throw Fortitude DC 18; Stage 1 drained 1 (1 week); Stage 2 drained 2 (1 week); Stage 3 6d6 damage, 3d6 hand size tentamorts emerge (disease ends)

description:
This dark blue creature has a conical body covered in angry red eyes and numerous tentacles, two of which are longer than the rest.
**Tactics** Once a tentamort has grabbed prey, it tends to focus entirely on that creature, ignoring attacks upon it from other sources. Once it has feasted on a prey and implanted eggs in it, it moves on to the next victim.

strikes.name: Tentacle
strikes.damage: 2d6+5 bludgeoning plus grab (maximum one creature grabbed)
